Reviews.Title: “Good location, great price, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: FLUSAMama
Reviews.Content: Another great stay at a La Quinta with our dog and kids. While the outside area may not looks so great, inside the hotel is very nice. It's also easy to get anywhere from there as the highway is nearby as well as beaches. Very nice and clean hotel, appreciate the "modern" feel of the rooms with really nice decor, vanities, etc. The wifi does need a little tweaking, but overall, would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Horrible location.”
Reviews.Author: flyingbnm
Reviews.Content: We were to spend five days here, but left after only two. The room was spacious, the bed comfy, the bathroom clean. We were literally driven nuts by the room air conditioner. There was no wall thermometer, so we were either shivering, or uncomfortably hot. There was no comfort there. The hotel itself is located in a very, busy, very congested area, near the 5 freeway. The traffic was unrelenting no matter the time of day. Every time we left the hotel it was pure madness. The streets were always packed with a line of cars. Very unpleasant indeed. We saw some unsavory characters strolling through the parking lot, walking around our car and other cars. That was disturbing. Further, there appeared to be several encampments of grizzly homeless people about the outside of the hotel. We just didn't feel safe there. We checked out the hot tub. When we came back some ten hours later, the same group of rowdy drunk people were still where they were when we left. However, some 40 or 50 of their beer cans were carelessly strewn about. Nice that they had their own private hot tub with greenish yellow water! That was very poor of management not to keep an eye on the public areas. Jasmine and Susan were very kind, very sweet people. We enjoyed them immensely. Susan took a liking to our little dog and gave him lots of attention and treats. He liked her too. This hotel was recently renovated. They did a fine job. But, they can't change the location of the property. And that was the reason we chose to leave. The owner should promote Jasmine. She is one of the precious few people who truly understand hospitality. An amazing young lady.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: dan3mike
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant stay at this hotel. The breakfast choices were impressive for the price we paid, juices, coffee, omelets, sausage, sausage gravy and assorted danish/breads. The dining area was clean and spotless, nobody rushed you out at closing time. The staff was friendly and accommodating. The location is next to I-5 which was very convenient, yet the rooms were quiet. The only issue we had was the size of the pillows..they were a bit small. The front desk sent us four more pillows. The breakfast room could be open a bit later for us late risers. Overall a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for a wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: GailObrien636
Reviews.Content: Your updated hotel was such a pleasant surprise. the lobby and rooms and breakfast room are beautiful. But even more importand was your staff, especially Megan R at the front desk and Susan in the breakfast room. Thank you again Tom and Gail O'Brien 2/22/12---2/29/12

Reviews.Title: “A Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: Cricketerone
Reviews.Content: In recent years La Quinta Inns and Suites have become our default choices for accommodation, offering comfortable and affordable lodging and generally catering to all our needs. The hotel in Mission Bay is a little gem. The staff could not have been more helpful. It is managed by a young, energetic and friendly couple who went out of their way to make our stay memorable. Restaurant and sight-seeing suggestions were spot-on and the hotel location is conducive to both. The hotel is currently undergoing some renovation but this did not detract from our stay in the least. We would have no hesitation in recommending it to any age demographic and will certainly use it again on future trips to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “A Great stay Here. !!!”
Reviews.Author: George G
Reviews.Content: The staff here is wonderful ! Absolutly spot on with service and family oriented. Young energetic staff who works hard and has full respect. !!!!! The rooms are clean and the usuals are well kept. Reccomended. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Handsomejeremy
Reviews.Content: Everyone at the hotel was really nice but one person stuck out as going above and beyond and that was megan ruden behind the front desk. She gave reviews of local bars and restaurants, which was super helpful because I'm not wicked good with computers. It's also nice to see such a pretty girl every time I came into the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “La Quinta Inn with a Holiday Inn feel. Some loose ends to tie up.”
Reviews.Author: shazam10
Reviews.Content: Positives. I really liked the room. It was tastefully decorated. It looked new. The wooden tiles in the bathroom and in the foyer made it look modern and the carpets are a good look too. There was also a lovely lcd tv. The bed was very comfortable (I think its the beds from Holiday Inn) and the sheets and blankets they used felt great (again I think its Holiday Inn's). The staff were friendly which was nice. Shower head had good pressure and spread. Negatives. The towels were still the same towels from Holiday Inn (they had the tag!), the phone still had the Holiday Inn logo on it, wiring was exposed and some of the wall tiles were not connected properly exposing what was underneath it. Its clear that they've rushed to open. Overall, I feel that this La Quinta has benefited from taking over a Holiday Inn. It has a Holiday Inn feel about it from the beds to the shower head. I enjoyed my stay nonetheless and if I ever return to San Diego I would definately stay here if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: SolarCTS
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an area that is easy to access all areas in San Diego from. Easy on and off the freeway. Short drive to the beach, right near mission bay and walking distance to In n out Burger. The Rooms are very nice and the Staff was very friendly. The continental breakfast here is also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff and great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: tsantiris
Reviews.Content: This establishment is now Mission Bay Lodge (name changed earlier this month, after no longer affiliated with Holiday Inn Express), so it is a little bit confusing right now trying to check out reviews. This motel is convenient, clean and friendly. It is easy to find and convenient to the highway. The staff members really went the extra mile in helping when there was a last minute change of plans concerning a reservation, and I was very impressed with their hands-on, can-do attitude. The breakfast was excellent, and provided a great way to start a day in San DIego.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Blueeyedlilly
Reviews.Content: My brother was coming in on the USS Ronald Reagan, so we decided that we wanted to stay in San Diego for the weekend to take our 2 yr old son to Sea World. After searching the internet extensively for a respectable hotel that was in our price rage, that wasnt infested with bed bugs or had unwanted people patrolling the parking lots, we decided with this one. It was a very good choice! We were very close to Sea World and eateries in the area which was a plus in itself. I was kinda leary when we first got to the place because of where it sits. It sits on a little side street next to the freeway, next to a boat storage facility. I was thinking to myself are we safe here? Is my car going to get broken into? But after the 1st night all my worries were soon gone. The hotel staff are extremely friendly and very helpful. The rooms are very big and comfortable. The fridge and microwave came in very handy with a toddler who needs milk and other perishable items at his beck and call hahaha I am not a breakfast eater by no means but I have this funny quirk. When I stay at a hotel it has to have a continental breakfast!!! This hotel's breakfast didnt disappoint! The pancakes were made right there, juice, all kinds of bread, bagels, muffins, eggs (scrambled one day, then a mini cheese omelet the other day), buttermilk biscuits, sausage gravy (which for a hotel was pretty delicious), sausage, ham, yogurt, cinnamon rolls (when warmed in the microwave were finger lickin good!!), cereals (4 choices), coffee and juices. I was in breakfast heaven... :) The room was well equipped with great amenities. It was clean, stocked daily, towels and bedding changed every time as well. Put it to a test to make sure they changed our sheets every day! LOL The only thing that we didnt like was, we asked for joining rooms that way we could go in and out of each other's rooms. When we got into our rooms we found out they were joining. No big deal really its just we didnt like having to leave our door propped open so we can go in and out freely. We were located at the very end of the hallway so we really didnt have to worry about foot traffic but none the less we didnt like that detail. When we stay in San Diego and need a hotel we will definitely be booking with them everytime. It was a great, clean, respectable, affordable hotel in San Diego that is close to all the tourist spots.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: KoryStory
Reviews.Content: It was my first real trip to San Diego and I couldn't afford an expensive hotel, but this place worked out great. I'll list the pros and cons below, but I first wanted to tell everyone who goes here that there are TWO parking levels. I stayed at this hotel for four nights and the first two nights, I didn't realize there was an underground parking lot. Obviously I wasn't the only one because the ground level parking lot was always packed at night, while the other one was usually empty. Pros: Within 5-6 miles of most places you want to be including restaurants (really close to an In-n-Out), shopping, at least 3 beaches, and the Gaslamp downtown area. Free wifi Internet. Comfy new beds (I love the pillows!). Decent, clean rooms. Polite employees. And probably the BEST free continental breakfast I've ever had at a hotel (eggs, sausage, toast, yogurt, etc.) Cons: The pool was dirty. The fitness room smelled really bad (it had that old musty smell) and consisted of a few old workout machines that hadn't seemed to be updated in a decade. Only one elevator, and was pretty slow. But overall, for the price I paid ($49 a night on Priceline), I would definitely stay here again. If you're on a budget and you don't need special amenities like a pool and fitness room, then this is the perfect place in San Diego to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Suited our needs”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaChrisAmy
Reviews.Content: The staff was pleasant and courteous. The rooms were clean and well-appointed. Comfortable beds, large rooms, decent breakfast. Being only a three story hotel, the elevator was painfully slow. Although close to Mission Bay and the beach, the traffic in the area makes for a slow jaunt to these places. But price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Motel; Compact Location”
Reviews.Author: CoastFan
Reviews.Content: The staff puts out. Check-in and check-out were both breezes, and the room was clean indeed, while the folks working the complementary breakfast kept things going in an environment that had only bananas for fresh fruit to complement a pedestrian, though extensive, breakfast selection that did include yogurt and some thing that claimed it would make pancakes. My principal traveling companion thought the bathroom did not feel cramped, though it was small; and the fact that there is more counter space just outside the bathroom door in what now holds the in-room coffee maker was appreciated. There are only three sets of towels, but a sign notes that pool patrons can get towels there. Old fogey that I am, I did not like that the desk chair was right where the air conditioner was at its basically quiet best. Noting that normal people lay in bed with laptops, I'm sure the quality of my handwriting is such that no one noticed I jerry-rigged a writing platform at a bed's edge. The HBO channel, and most of the rest of the approximately 45 working channels were correctly listed on the off-screen guide to the local array. The main level parking areas were so cramped I regularly chose to back up onto the street rather than executing "W" turns. The lower level garage appeared refreshingly normal, though by using that garage one misses out on the main level garage baggage carts, and the fruit set out in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, near attractions”
Reviews.Author: chsclassmates
Reviews.Content: The hotel was near the beach, Sea World and San Diego Zoo. Had a very nice breakfast. It was a little tight for 4 people and I wish there was another plug near the mirror in the room for getting ready in the morning but a nice room. One of the quietest hotel rooms I have ever been in.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay some drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: Novoas
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to San Diego, the hotel is located by the freeway close to Sea World. Noise wasn't an issue for us we didn't hear any freeway noise in our room. The room was surprisingly large to what we had encountered thus far on our trip and appeared to be recently renovated. Parking on site is predominatly under cover, the car park was well lit of a night but we found it quite tight to park and we were only driving a 2 door car. It would have been nice for the car park to have at least a security gate. We took one tour from the hotel and were told we had to wait at the bottom of the rear driveway to be collected, At the bottom of the driveway was a group of men about 12-15 appeared to be homeless, not seeing homeless people where we are from its a little intimidating especially for my wife. They were harmless but none the less still a little intimidated. We stayed there while comicon was on so prices were quite high, we felt we were paying a bit too much but we had to wear it because the whole town seemed to be booked out.

Reviews.Title: “Great value...would come back anytime!”
Reviews.Author: KDCRAE
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my family on our vacation for 12 nights. We arrived at 1am and our check-in was friendly and uneventful (good thing...since our flight had been delayed on the east coast and our little ones couldn't take much more). The next morning we headed down to the breakfast room which was really nice and everyone was able to find something. The breakfast varies every 2 days so at least there is some variety and we're not fussy, so we were happy. And the coffee was good. The location was great for our activities. We had a rental car and parking was free. This hotel is right next to the highway so it's an easy drive to the downtown (about 15-20 min), to the airport (20 min), or up the road to LA or Disneyland (about 1.5-2hours). We really enjoyed our stay and for the price....terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Great bang for the buck!”
Reviews.Author: Ukie73
Reviews.Content: Was an excellent value for our family vacation. Breakfast was good and perfect for our plans. The hotel was in a great location within the city of San Diego. Staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Was disappointed for a Holiday Inn Express”
Reviews.Author: CKT1962
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in an unsavory area and you had to drive everywhere. Parking lot was crazy small and hard to manuver your vehicle in. Breakfast area was so small that on a Sunday morning, it was so crowded, we could not get in the door. So much for the free breakfast. Heard people in adjoining rooms clearly!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, nice place!”
Reviews.Author: SuzeePee
Reviews.Content: Our daughter is a UCSD student, and this is the place my husband or I stay when we're driving down to pick up or drop off. It's a lot less expensive than anywhere in La Jolla, but just five minutes south of campus on 5. As other posters have noted, it's not in a desirable tourist area, but it's never felt unsafe to us, and with a car we're just minutes from the beach, downtown SD, La Jolla and more. We are regulars because the staff is fantastic and the facilities are great. Everyone working at the hotel goes out of his/her way to help guests have the best stay possible. Priority Club members get a goodie bag, and the bottled water and treats are just what's called for after a long drive. The rooms are large, well-appointed (fridge, micro, wifi, great beds), quiet and very clean. The breakfast is open early (so we can hit the road early) and there's a wide variety of stuff. There's a fitness room (but, if you can run on the beach...why you'd use it I don't know) and pool. If you're looking for a Hotel del Coronado experience, this won't make you happy. but if you're looking for a clean, comfortable, well-appointed, reasonably-priced place to stay, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING!!”
Reviews.Author: vickiguist
Reviews.Content: I was here for medical purposes so my stay was rather long and they were just wonderful to my husband and I each and every day! The staff, desk, cleaning, and manager are all wonderful and friendly. It is not in hotel row or along the beach so you will not just walk out the door and be in the middle of a tourist area but most people get a rental car while on vacation or business travel and this location is not more then a few miles from anything you may want to do. The customer service makes it worth being a little off the tourist path. There are two parking areas so there is always a spot availble, even when the hotel is full. There is a breakfast served in the morning with both hot and cold foods. It's not a big buffett style but it's much better then any other place I've stayed that offered a "continental breakfast". There are eggs, meat, pastries, juices, milk, coffee, fruits, breads, etc... We have to come back to this area again in three months and I will not stay anywhere else! Thank you staff of the holiday Inn Express Mission Bay!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, large rooms, decent location for our family”
Reviews.Author: tvlnkds
Reviews.Content: We weren't sure what to expect based on other reviews, and while we see the point for some of the negatives (some street noise, not a walkable location, ect), this hotel was PERFECT for our family. While driving around town during our various sightseeing trips and making mental notes about the other hotels we could have chosen in this price range, we now feel very confident that we made the right choice for our trip by staying here. Our room on the 3rd floor was both large and clean, the mini fridge and microwave helped a lot with our little kids, front desk staff was friendly, housekeeping was thorough, and the crib supplied by the hotel (pack-n-play) worked well for our baby. I think we would have had a hard time driving to this hotel without our GPS. Once we figured out the location (and the GPS gave good directions - problems were from driver error!) and got used to San Diego traffic in general, we found this location to work well for us. We stayed for 7 nights and did all of the typical family activities around town.

Reviews.Title: “overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: 1_trip_planner
Reviews.Content: We got in late and slept over the night. Was nice, comfortable and clean. Was also close to SeaWorld which was our destination.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Enough We Didn't Stay!”
Reviews.Author: hydroxero
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked this hotel the day of our stay while on a road trip through California. I will say first that yes, it is not in your best interest to try to get a hotel reservation the same day you arrive in San Diego, but it couldn't be avoided with the nature of our trip. Anyway, we booked three nights at this hotel and arrived at the property. I wasn't thrilled with the neighborhood-as others have said it's a little more than questionable. There are suspicious homes directly behind the hotel and car sales lots at the bottom of the hill. Anyway, this seemed to be the best we could do so we reluctantly checked in. You know things aren't going to be good when the clerk says, "Take the elevator DOWN to your room." Great. So we head DOWN the stairs. The first thing I encounter is the "security" door is propped open. This door leads from the parking area (not gated, not secure) directly into the hotel! This is a big safety issue as far as I was concerned. Especially since we quickly discover that our room is the first one next to this open door. So we go into our room and it is beyond basic. The bathroom seemed fine enough, but the bed seemed close to the ground, thin, and sagging in the center. I'm a freak about bugs, so I checked the mattress. While I didn't encounter anything, the mattresses they have can only be described as "bed in a bag"...it was almost like the mattress was wrapped in a nylon stocking. While I was investigating the bed my boyfriend looks out the window only to discover that our "view" is of a sidewalk, but you are eye-level with the sidewalk, as in staring at people's feet and ankles as they pass! He also observed some shady "business deal" taking place across the street. Anyway, I decided this was completely unacceptable for all the above mentioned issues. We decided to ask for a refund. The one pro of this event is that, when I explained our concerns with the property, the clerk agreed to give us a full refund. My boyfriend did have to follow up a few days later however to have the charge removed from his card. I have stayed at Holiday Inns before and this one is AWFUL! We decided to take our chances and look for somewhere else in the city that seemed to be 100% booked. To share what ended up happening: We had booked this hotel for $180 a night (I wouldn't even pay $50 to stay here) and ended up staying at a RESORT in Mission Bay (Paradise Point) for $220 a night. A difference of $40!!! Anyway, I'm pretty reasonable, but even for travellers on a budget this hotel was not worth it. We had a great time at the other property, felt safe, relaxed, and didn't have to worry about getting robbed in the middle of the night.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place to stay!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MIDMO95
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Holiday Inn Express-Mission Bay between June 21-25. Booked the hotel through Southwest Airline Vacations. We thought the hotel was perfect for what we were looking for. Yes, it was near an Interstate. However, never heard any road noise at night. Did not even realize an employment office was in the area. The hotel was clean. Had two parking garages. It was close to everything that we wanted to go to. The staff was friendly during check in and check out and all times between. The rooms were nice. We had three people in our room. I could see if you had a large group in one room it could become small. I think the best part of the hotel was the hot breakfast. The ladies that served breakfast really worked hard. Plus the food was good and tasty. It really started the morning off good. Would we stay here again??? For the price and service I don't think we could resist.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: Bhulbert
Reviews.Content: Okay here is the deal with this hotel. I just got back on my trip. We were pleased with many things and not so please with other things. Here are the things we were pleased about. The employees are nice and friendly and very knowledgable about places to go and places to eat. The rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable I think they were new. All surfaces in the rooms were granite. It had a small refrigerator and microwave in the room. The gym was small but suffiecient with a treadmill and a eliptical machine, and 2 bikes with a Tv to watch. They have a coin washer and dryer which was nice when we got back from the beach. The hotel is convienent to get on the freeways. Parking is free with a garage to park in. It has a pool and spa even though they are small. It has a warm breakfast buffet with eggs, bacon, bisquits and gravy, muffins, cinnamon rolls, bagel, yogurt, cereal, and fruit that was good and convienent. Ok here are the things that were bad. The spa needs resurfaced and only seats 4 people at a time.There is a employment center next door where a lot of homeless/ dirty people hang out looking for jobs, but they never once tried to bum money off of us or even talk to us. You have to drive 10minutes to the beach or anyplace else. No restaraunts close to the hotel that you can walk to only a Mcdonalds and Inn and out Burger. The carpet seemed to be a little dirty could use some cleaning. Last but not least the rooms felt a little crammed. We were all togethor pleased with the hotel and staff and the price that we paid for our rooms. The only reason that I would probably not recommend this hotel is if somebody wanted to be on the beach or really close to it.

Reviews.Title: “3 Star Really?”
Reviews.Author: mobius5
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on hotwire because it claimed it was a 3 Star Mission Bay Hotel. Really? It was located right off the freeway next to a storage facility, location could be considered a light industrial area. I used to have excellent luck with hotwire, but have been disappointed in my last couple of bookings. Especially this last one because I booked five rooms for family for our daughter's college graduation. This hotel id definitely a 2 star! I would like to say that the staff was kind and helpful and that the rooms were nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Read the review on this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hamiltonsteve
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel thru [one of those online booking places that doesn't tell you the name of the hotel before you book and is owned by the same company as this site] who claims it is a 3-star class hotel which it is clearly not -- check other major sites and you will find it is almost universally considered 2 or 2.5 stars and has numerous bad reviews and references to certain online booking sites that falsely claim it is 3 stars. It is located next to some kind of homeless shelter or something so there were transients milling around. My family were scared to stay there so we immediately rebooked a different hotel when we arrived. The company that sold it to us flatly refuses to refund us even though it is clearly false advertising to claim this is a 3-star hotel. We are pursuing the matter with the AG's office in California and Washington as well as the BBB in both areas. I would encourage others who have been ripped off to do the same. http://ag.ca.gov/contact/complaint_form.php?cmplt=CL http://sandiego.bbb.org/

Reviews.Title: “Manager and Parking was AWFUL!”
Reviews.Author: professional10
Reviews.Content: When checking in to this hotel I parked in an end spot-so I could easily get out in the morning- I woke to find myself blocked in - by somone that was parked illegally. The "manager" rolled his eyes at me and told he "he thinks he could get my car out". When I asked him to sign a waiver for driving my company car- he acted as if that was silly. He acted totally unprofessional and this was a terrible experience. It took an hour to get teh idiot to move his car so I could leave. PS- the room wasn't very clean either-especially the bathroom floor.

Reviews.Title: “It's all in WHY you're staying here...”
Reviews.Author: jimb78
Reviews.Content: Luckily for us, when my family and I stayed at this Hotel, all we wanted was somewhere to sleep and have breakfast. And that's all we got. The staff when we checked in at night were neither rude nor friendly, they just seemed like they'd rather be somewhere else. The staff in the morning however, were very friendly, very helpful. The room we were given was essentially in the basement. They called it the ground floor, but it was below the 1st floor, so you do the math. We had the pool at one end of the hall and the laundry room at the other. Needless to say, our room was quite musty when we first got there, however, after running the A/C for a few minutes that faded rather quickly. The only real complaint I had was the bed. but isn't that the #1 thing most people expect from a Hotel is a comfortable bed? No matter why you're staying there, you want a comfortable bed. These were like sleeping on plywood. A lot of bounce to them, but it was the whole damn bed bouncing. My 3 and 6 year-old's didn't care, but my wife and I barely slept a wink. Breakfast in the morning was standard Holiday Inn fare, nothing spectacular. But again, the staff working in the breakfast area very friendly and attentive. All things considered, it could have been a lot worse, and I've stayed in a lot worse. But it could be a lot better too.

Reviews.Title: “Missed the mark!”
Reviews.Author: ryanwest
Reviews.Content: This Holiday Inn Express failed to meet the quality one normally finds at a Holiday Inn Express. The location is questionable at best. It is surrounded by auto repair shops and a self-storage facility. While in the room you could hear street traffic. There were stains on the sheets. The room smelled very musty. The breakfast area needed a good cleaning. The garbage from the breakfast area was piled up on a cart at the front door of the breakfast area. Parking is very tight. Large cars and pick-up trucks had a difficult time parking. The staff were very polite and professional.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for !”
Reviews.Author: exploringwilbury
Reviews.Content: Booked this through hotwire as a last minute deal and at $59 a night, I shouldn't really be complaining...But having traveled a bit and used to better hotels, I think I erred in penny pinching. ...In fact, at the same rate I had previously gotten better hotels in diff cities but it was not to be this time.. My only objective was being close to the Sea world, however, I think others would not have been too far either...Anyways, not much of Pros except that its off I-5 and relatively closer to Sea World.. Cons - No character whatsoever even though its in this beautiful city Cramped room, virtually no space in hallways No views Very small breakfast room which serves sub optimal Overall , I am sure you would find a better deal for slightly more...But if you are budget traveler -just shacking in for the night, then wherever you stay doesn't matter

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, not so clean”
Reviews.Author: JetlagBrazil
Reviews.Content: The location is fine, but we have to change the rooms twice because of the smell of cigarette and the dirty bathroom. Highway noise is also a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, clean hotel, surprised by overall experience.”
Reviews.Author: pambayonso
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay here on priceline (by bidding) and then went and read reviews on it. So many reviews were awful that I was worried it would be a nasty hotel. I should say that I am pretty simple and don't look for expensive art or fancy frills in a hotel. The immediate location isn't great (the surrounding buildings and streets aren't picturesque or high end), but it is in Mission Beach and not far from the beach (by car - 5 minutes). The outside of the hotel wasn't warm and inviting (part of that was location), but it was safe and clean. The staff was always helpful and friendly. Our rooms were very clean and everything worked well. There was free wifi in the rooms. The TV had quite a few channels. The heater/ac was quiet and worked well. The workout room was small, but adequate. The hot tub was great. The pool truly was heated (we swam in at at night in November) if a bit small. The free breakfast was very good. The two mornings we were there they always had biscuits and gravy, muffins, cinamon rolls, juices, milk, some fruit, cereal, yogurt, etc... They also had some sort of hot egg (omelet or scrambled). They had either sausage or bacon. That saved us lots of money. There was free parking in a parking ramp attached to the hotel. There weren't any frills at the hotel. It wasn't fancy... but it provided all we wanted. We met one couple there who found ants in their room, but they were given a new room right away - and were happy with how it was handled.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & Staff”
Reviews.Author: cali1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 separate times 2 weekends in a row while visiting Sea World. It's a great value for the price and you can't beat the location as it's right off the freeway. The staff is very friendly and helpful. They have a wonderful FREE breakfast! The rooms are very nice and clean. I'm a very picky traveler when it comes to beds. I would raither pay more for a comforitable bed so I was very happy that the beds were very comforitable pillowtops. The first weekend I stayed here the room was on the 2nd floor. The elevator is very slow so the next weekend we came back I asked for a room on the 1st floor so I didn't have to deal with it. They happily filled my request but after setteling in I realized that the bed was hard as a rock. I then went and asked the front desk for a room with a pillowtop and he was very nice and let me change rooms. Apparently not all the rooms have a new mattress. He then put me on the ground (basement) floor. Make sure you don't get this floor! It's where they do the laundry so it's very hot and the window is equal level to the street so it made me a little nervious. Aside from that, it was a very nice weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel value and cleanliness won over pricey beach hotels”
Reviews.Author: BudgetJunkie
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean and the staff were very friendly from start to finish. The room was very clean and quiet. The bed was wonderful and we got a very good nights sleep on it. The pillows were great, they had one for firm and one for soft, you choose which one you prefer. The only problem with this hotel is it's right next to the I-5 freeway and is on a busy intersection. However, there wasn't a noise problem like I thought there would be, it was quiet all night long. I agree completely with other reviewers, you need a car to get around San Diego if you stay here. The beach is a 15 minute drive away, but beware that there is a lot of traffic in this location and the streets are narrow and many people do not know how to drive! Overall I would absolutely recommend this place as it was priced right and it didn't pretend to be something it wasn't. You'll find that other hotels charge an arm and a leg for parking! It was free here and they had free wireless internet access which was a big plus in my book!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING HOTEL, AWESOME RATES!!!”
Reviews.Author: becnkipplus2
Reviews.Content: We couldn't believe how clean and nice the rooms were for the rate we paid through Hotwire!!! The staff was so friendly and accomodating! Loved that the breakfast was so fresh everyday; awesome breakfast staff too. Very quaint and quiet hotel, had a nice relaxing pool and hot tub. Great location, so close to the beaches and Sea World. Will absolutely stay there on our next visit!!!! Would definately recommend to those of you who are tired of staying at large chain hotels with not so great staff. This was perfect for our first trip to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location: close to SeaWorld, beaches, restaurants, freeway”
Reviews.Author: bestabillojr
Reviews.Content: Less than 10 minutes from SeaWorld. 5 minutes from Pacific Beach. 10 minutes from Mission Beach. Easy on/off access to freeway. Close to shopping and restaurants. Convenient fridge and microwave in room. Excellent service from ALL staff. Parking and breakfast room can get crowded. Would definitely stay here again. Would recommend to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “We call it the Helliday Inn Express”
Reviews.Author: giverny1
Reviews.Content: My family and I had to stay here because we got screwed by Hotwire blatantly misrepresenting the property and then refusing to cancel the reservation. They are dreaming when they call this a three-star hotel, and they've had enough complaints by now that they know it. Giving this place even two stars would be overly generous. The hotel is located in a commercia/industrial neighborhood right off of the freeway, so the only views you're going to have are of nearby alleys and buildings. Our ground-floor room was dark, gloomy and smelled terrible. There were stains on the sheets and hairs in the bathtub -- definitely one of those places where you feel like you should keep your shoes on. The building is so cheaply built that we could hear every move that our neighbors made, thank goodness they were considerate and didn't make a lot of noise. The one good point about this hotel is the breakfast, which was generous and tasty, but definitely not worth spending the night here. If Hotwire is offering a "three-star hotel" in Mission Bay, don't do it, it just might be this one!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and most spacious rooms!”
Reviews.Author: canwheaton
Reviews.Content: We booked here with a good AAA rate, and requested a room with two queen beds. We received a room with 2 king beds, which had even additional room in it. The beds were comfortable and pillows monogrammed as to hard or soft on the pillowcase edge, the shower was very good and had a free plentiful buffet breakfast! Nothing more we could want for our family, as our time was spent traveling and viewing things. We also received a nice food snack bag upon check in.The hotel staff was also very helpful and kind.

Reviews.Title: “Once the renovations are finished this will be a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mo78
Reviews.Content: The pool is lovely! but due to the renovations you have to walk outside around the hotel to get to it, and there is no lock so not too sure about the safety aspect. Great location onto the I-5 up to La Jolla etc, and only 2 miles from Mission Beach.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: alhambramd
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night prior to a job interview in San Diego. I have to admit I had my doubts after reading reviews that commented on the not so desirable location. The hotel entrance was narrow and hard to get to. But true to what other TA reviews said, the hotel itself is far from a disappointment. The hotel staff were really friendly and checking in was a breeze. The hotel's proximity to Mission Bay was a huge plus. Did not have any issues with parking, I thought parking spaces were ample (there was a multi level parking lot attached to the hotel). The room itself was clean and looked newly remodeled. Beds were really comfortable and the two sets of pillows (firm and soft) were a nice touch. The bathrooms though I can foresee could develop molding if we stayed there for several days because it didn't have an exhaust fan so moisture tends to accumulate. But becuase we only stayed 1 night, it wasn't a problem. The continental breakfast was more like a full breakfast, with loaves of bread, pastries, rolls, sausages and omelets, a juice and coffee station. It was a great value, a steal for the price we paid for a night's stay ($62 inclusive of taxes at Hotwire.com). The verdict: Would stay again if I needed to be in the Mission Bay area. But then again there are so many other choices closer to the downtown area. But definitely loved their beds and their breakfasts. Those were the highlights of my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pacific Beach right next to I-5”
Reviews.Author: 234rhc
Reviews.Content: Surprisingly good location for $73 a night at the Entertainment book rate. regular discounted rates just slightly higher. Beds could be more comfortable but were acceptable. Parking was toght but not as bad a we had thought based on some reviews .Fee parking and no problem finding it was also a plus. Strangely the hotel kept changing the rate--$10 lower, twice. Hot breakfast varied from day to day with cheese omelets and bacon or sausage. Great hot cinammon rolls, too. Nice way to start the day. All in all perhaps not as plush as desired but room attendants were superb.

Reviews.Title: “Great -especially for the price”
Reviews.Author: WAfamoffour
Reviews.Content: This isn't the most glamorous hotel, but the price is great, the staff was nice and except for a small mold issue (see the last line of my review), the hotel is clean. We paid a bit extra and booked one of the three rooms with king sized beds. Although it was on the second floor, in front of the elevator, we didn't hear too much noise from people coming and going. Pros: free breakfast and internet, helpful and nice staff, convenient location (right off highway, close to Sea World, and a pretty much straight shot drive -5 to 10 min.- to the beach) and free parking. Cons: The parking is tight (but it is free and there is a lower level that is also available), small pool (which was cold. The hottub wasn't much warmer), and towels are not available at the pool so you must remember to bring them from your room or ask for more at the desk. Individual room quirk: Whenever we would turn our television on, it would come on at the highest volume possible, even if we had it set to the lowest volume setting upon turning it off prior. Not a lot of shelf/counter top space in the room or bathroom. The bathroom didn't vent well and we watched mold spread throughout the week, on the ceiling, above the tub. Overall, considering the prices of hotels in the San Diego area, we felt we found a great deal and would stay here again. If you have an Entertainment Book, I found using this saved me more money than advance purchase, AAA rate or "best internet" rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; Worked Just Fine”
Reviews.Author: HOnestABE18
Reviews.Content: To get to the Hotel, use google or Yahoo directions. The hotel is a little tricky to get to, so the directions are helpful. The internet driving direction sites do NOT note that there is a right turn on Damon that provides a short cut to the property. The underground parking lot is off this side alley. Parking is tight, real tight. A big truck sticks out a bit, so use the bottom lot if you have a big vehicle. The property is pie-shaped and back from the main street. The staff was quite helpful. I interacted with 3 different individuals and they were all helpful. We needed to check out at 4:30AM in the morning to get to the Carlsbad Marathon and the food was already out at that time, which was really nice. The staff person said to take whatever we wanted and even gave us some lids for the juices. The breakfast is above average with hot food such as eggs and sausage. Yogurt, hard-boiled eggs, cereal, juices, milk, etc was all there and nicely laid out. There is not a lot of restaurants nearby. There was a McDonalds, which we did not go to. We really didn't hang out at the hotel. The rooms were what you would expect from a Holiday Inn Express. No worse, no better. I used the free internet service and it was easy to connect to and was fast enough to meet my needs from my room on 3rd floor. There is also a computer in the lobby that is availble for guests, which I always think is a nice feature. All in all, the price here was $20 cheaper than comparable hotels in the area. We got what we paid for. I would stay here again under the same circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: theh
Reviews.Content: We had no problems at all. Staff was very friendly. The room was clean. The area was quiet. WiFi is free and they have a computer you can use by the front desk. Excellent free breakfast. There's a pool and hot tub. The location was wonderful. The view isn't exactly the most beautiful view of the city, but every place we went was so close by. I think the longest drive we made was 15 minutes to La Jolla. This is no luxury hotel, but it's convenient and all-inclusive. A great price for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “A solid hotel with a few little quirks”
Reviews.Author: akabigj
Reviews.Content: We stayed just one night here in room 205 and I thought the place was great with just a few little quirks. Sure, the parking is a little tight but that's not that big of a deal in my opinion, just remember to check your mirrors getting out. Yes, the location is a little strange and not in the nicest of areas but once you get in the hotel you forget about that. Check-in was quick and friendly with great service by Keith at the desk. He even called to make sure everything was satisfactory once we got to our room, a very nice touch. The room was clean and comfortable but a little stuffy, it could of used some fresh air but the windows only open about 4 inches. I enjoyed the toiletries provided and the pool was quiet and clean. No towels were provided at the pool so I had to borrow some hand towels from the nearby exercise room instead of going back up to my room. It is also very close to the scene on Garnet Ave and Pacific Beach so that was cool. So, all in all I thought the place was great value for the price ($86) and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Space Was Beyond Our Expectation”
Reviews.Author: formosangirl
Reviews.Content: We chose bed size over view and received an enormous room. We were in a room on the same level as the small swimming pool that the kids really enjoyed. The room was so big, it could have easily fit a total of 3 king size beds. And through the Entertainment Book, we got it for $97. Since we were just passing through, it almost met all of our expectations. The water from the shower didn't work like we wanted, but the room had a refrigerator and a coffee maker and a hair dryer. Plus, the free hot breakfast bar was plentiful. You can't beat the price and the value.

Reviews.Title: “They should pay you to stay here”
Reviews.Author: anasazi3
Reviews.Content: Do not under any circumstances stay at this hotel. I endured the tortures of the damned for several hours before leaving and finding another hotel at 2 am. Smelly loud rooms, rude drunk staff. The ninth level of hell Save yourself....for me it's too late

Reviews.Title: “An alright stay”
Reviews.Author: utahvacationers
Reviews.Content: I read tons and tons of hotel reviews before booking. It was important for us to have a fridge/microwave and a free breakfast. We of course were on a budget, so we chose this hotel and I don't regret it. The hot breakfast is a plus. I need that extra protein in the mornings. It's not a grand breakfast, but it had good variety: bacon one day sausage the next, eggs, fruit, yogurt, bagels, pastries, cereal, etc. The room itself was okay. The front of the hotel faces a freeway and it bothered me the first night. After that we had the air on and I didn't hear a thing. There is a pool and hot tub, we saw many guests using them. Parking is a squeeze, but note that there is parking on a lower level as well. If you are just planning to sleep here I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Where's the Love for the Holidaaae Innn???”
Reviews.Author: cowboys22
Reviews.Content: I just finished stay at the HIE Mission Bay and I'll admit, after reading several reviews on here, I thought about changing my arrangments but in the end I stayed put. I'm glad I did and at the same time I probably would have chosen a different hotel (logistical reasons only). Review: This hotel is appropriately rated as a 2-2.5 Star accomodation. The hotel itself is nothing that will knock your socks off but the Customer Service was top notch and the staff was extremely helpful and friendly. I had requested a King room but they gave me a Double Queen room instead but it was no big deal. I stayed in on the 3rd floor and the room was very clean and comfortable. There was no "musty" smell that some other guests have reported but it appears if the just installed new carpeting and fresh paint on the walls so there is a bit of the "new" smell going on but not over powering. I found the bed(s) to be extremely comfortable with two choices of pillows (soft or firm), which I thought was a nice touch for sensitive sleepers. I was also really impressed with the quality of towels they provided. From the bath size down to the face cloths, they were very nice, almost robe-like in quality and thickness. Nothing major but a very nice touch in my opinion. The Hot Breakfast wasn't the greatest but there were lots of options with regards to bagels and english muffins, baked goods, cereals, coffee and juices. I found it to be avove average as far as Continentals go. The Business Center consists of a desktop computer with a laser printer. Definitely not what I would consider a BC but for some who does not have a lap top or needed to print out some documents, it was more than serviceable. Free Wi-Fi is pretty standard now but it was nice to have. The HIE also had a Pool and Cardio center which I did not use but it was nice to know it was available. I don't have much negative to say about the hotel but as another guest reported, the desk is located right next to the AC Unit so I had to turn it off and on every now and then. The free parking is limited and is a little tight at the front but under cover it's like a normal parking lot. The hotel is also a little tricky to get to, depending on how you're coming in. A little navigation savvy is required but after a day of driving around it's not too bad. In the end, I was pleasantly surprised considering the beating this hotel took in previous reviews. Perhaps all of the positives were due to recent renovations but either way, I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Friends don't let friends stay here.”
Reviews.Author: aufvedersehen
Reviews.Content: Well first of all let me say I would never stay at this hotel again. Here is why,there are mainance problems that needs to be addressed to bring this hotel back to be comfortable.Such as repairing the rooms AC units. That musty smell that was in our room. Now to the good parts, yes there was some, the free hot starts breakfast was really good.there was an assortment of eggs or omilets,bacon,sausage,biscuits, but never saw any gravy...how odd.Toast,bagels,muffins juice and coffe and tea. Yes the pool and whirlpool was small but fairly well kept. The staff was very nice which was a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Came through in a Pinch, Awkward entrance though”
Reviews.Author: gahlisary
Reviews.Content: Came out to San Diego to visit a few buddies for a fun weekend of drinking, visiting the beach, Tiajana, and more drinking. Unfortunately my two idiot buddies jumped the gun and had passed out from an all day bender by the time my deeply delayed US Air flight arrived. By the time the cab got me to Pacific Beach and they weren't picking up their phones, I had to resort to other options. Told the cabbie to find me a cheap hotel, and the Holiday Inn Express at the corner of Garnett and Mission Bay was right there off the interstate and looked assecible. Had never stayed in a Holiday Inn Express before but had heard the chain was fine, so with few other options nearby, gave it a try. The arrival experience is a debacle. Got out at the intersection and walked up the ramp, but had to walk up and down the ramp, through a garage and around the property to find the entrance. it's not intuituive. Walk-in rate was about $120, a lot more than I'd expect for some limited service property like this, but was I to complain at 3 in the morning in a city i didnt know with friends that I didnt like anymore. Check-in guy was friendly enough, but the process was long as he had to input all my info. Room was fine, actually more upscale than I expected, bed nothing special, bathroom small, but it was clean. Hotel had interior hallways which is a positive and basic, but new-looking furniture. Didn't see the pool area, or try out the wi-fi or notice if hotel had a gym or not. Breakfast was decent enough, small crappy little room though, didnt see any outdoor seating, which would have been nice for what was a beautiful San Diego morning. Thought those Holiday Inn Express cinamin buns were pretty tasty. All in all, it did the trick, but certainly wasn't cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: johno60
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a reasonably priced hotel and decided on the Holiday Inn Express at Mission Bay. It sounded like a good location but when we arrived it is situated behind an auto repair shop on a busy intersection. When we checked in, the staff were very friendly and helpful but that is about as good as it gets. The room had a musty smell to it and the bathroom was less than desirable. When we went downstairs to use the pool and whirlpool it got worse. The pool was small and dirty plus the whirlpool had a cigarette butt floating in it!!!!! The only good thing was the free continental breakfast in the morning. Needless to say, we stayed only one night and cancelled the remaining three nights. I definitely would not recommend this hotel. We booked a competitor's hotel for the same price and had a great time amd their pool was much larger and cleaner.

Reviews.Title: “UGHHHHH”
Reviews.Author: aeia
Reviews.Content: I didn't know what I was getting, my friend booked this hotel without my knowledge. It was night, and so I didn't have any problems with it at first. I noticed it was terribly humid in the lobby and when we came to our room it seemed clean and well-furnished. But the humidity was out of this world. I am from the desert, so I might think little humidity is alot, but there was a noticeable difference in the outside humidity to the inside. Once I started inspecting though, I found black mold all over the bathroom, under the wallpaper and more near the baseboards near the beds on the wall. It was so humid I almost passed out. The parking was horrific with tiny iddy biddy spots to squeeze into. Upon inspection, the entire facility dripped into the parking garage. The entire parking garage was dripping, everything in the hotel was wet and humid. The highlights were the fantastic staff, who put out the continental breakfast at 5am for us. The breakfast had some good cinnamon rolls, and otherwise was sub-par. The work out room had nice clean and new ish machines, but if you like watching tv the tv only worked on the bottom half. They offer a great cable package though I got to watch "Pinata: Survival Island" and that alone might have been worth the trip. There is also one computer for everyone but it doesnt run toooooo slow and at least they have a business center-type-computer at all. Thats about it. I only stayed the night, the humidity was terrible, so I couldnt have stayed there any more anyways. Also, when I woke up the next morning I realized we were crevassed away in an unsavoury part of town, right down the walkway is the day-labourer facility (The biggest Ive ever seen!) along with some hobos, a used car dealership and a couple ramshackle fast food places. Its not worth 100 dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to par, big disappointment and certainly not a 3 star facility!”
Reviews.Author: jffnjss
Reviews.Content: We purchased this hotel stay through HOTWIRE, requesting a 3 star facility. In no way is this a 3 star facility..... it's a 1.5 - 2. Here is the Good - the small room was pretty clean. The security guard on the night shift was pretty helpful. The microwave and fridge in the room was nice for extended stays, especially with children. They have a printed up directions sheet and map that helpful. Right around the highway. And the Bad- The location is pretty shady. There is a day workers meeting place right behind the hotel so you get men (homeless and stragglers with a few exceptions) wandering around the parking area and outside of the hotel. One guy even took a moment to take a leak next to a car in the parking area. H The vending machine and ice machine are located outside of the hotel in the parking area. The area around the hotel was pretty trashy, there were abandoned skids and trash all around the outside area of this hotel. The breakfast is pretty minimal IF you can get into the tiny area and IF there is anything left. Out of 7 days, we only ate in there 2 times. The pool area has pretty rickety furniture. The 1 elevator that services the entire hotel took forever. Only 2 luggage carts for the entire hotel, with a 3 star establishment (ha ha) you would expect more assistance or more carts at least! The hotel staff was wearing street clothes. They had a maintanace man who was wearing a track suit. Parking is a complete nightmare! if you get in late, then the few tight spaces are already filled you have to park on the street, keeping in mind that the men that are going to the day workers area and its a pretty shady area. DO NOT LEAVE ANYTHING IN YOUR CAR OF ANY TYPE OF VALUE. It's just an okay stay, but expecting it to be a 3 star facility it was a disappoinment and certainly not up to par.

Reviews.Title: “Not that good but not that bad either (long review)”
Reviews.Author: ray_in_60174
Reviews.Content: Ok, just got back from a three night, spring break stay with my wife and six y/o at this infamous hotel. I booked using Hotwire, my first time, and after the hotel name popped up I checked tripadvisor and I was scared to death after reading all the negative reviews. After telling my wife what happened she immediately sprang into action, God bless her, and she contacted the hotel manager and quizzed him regarding hotel condition, amenities and poor travel site reviews. He let her know that he knew exactly what she was talking about and that he was new and was brought in to remedy the problems. She felt good about their conversation and we decided to take a chance and check in. The Room: First, this is NOT a three star hotel and I will not be using Hotwire again because of this experience. I paid $98 a night for Mon/Tue/Wed during spring break which I guess was a fair price. At most, I'd give this hotel two stars. We stayed on the 3rd floor, freeway side and our room had been given a recent makeover (rm 325). It was clean but very small, with a tiny bathroom, and it included a microwave and mini-fridge. We didn't notice any excessive noise from the freeway. We had no problems with the room although I heard a few people being reassured by the manager that various problems like leaky plumbing and no electricity in the room were taken care of. Amenities: The pool and hot tub were small but functional on the bottom floor surrounded by a wooden security fence. Apparently new pool deck furniture is being ordered. The adjacent workout room was small but functional with 3 cardio machines. The hotel breakfast was of a type being offered at several hotel chains with cereal, various muffins and bagels, a toaster, yogurt, whole fruit, no meats and warm cinnamon rolls. The hotel also had a small plate of freshly baked cookies at the front desk every evening. There was a single computer and printer in the lobby for internet access first come, first serve. Parking was free (very unusual out there) but very cramped and totally unsecured which brings me to the location. Hotel Location: This hotel is on a typical steep grade leading up to the 5. There is no buffer to adjacent office buildings and businesses whatsoever. There are two, small parking garages one at the lobby level and one at the pool/basement level as well as a single row of spaces butting up to a wall opposite the lobby entrance. I wouldn't stay here without a car but if you get in late, you'd probably have to park in the street. It sure seems like San Diego parking spaces are more narrow that the rest of the country. At the bottom of the street on the west side of the hotel, there's a day laborer pickup area so we were treated to various sights like a laborer peeing in the street and homeless types walking back and forth by the open (unsecurable) basement garage entrance. Mission Beach: If you go west down Garnet to Grand you'll soon be at Mission Beach and a short drive from La Jolla and a number of beach areas. For those booking a family vacation, Mission Beach is a mixed bag with areas appealing to the young alternative adult types with lots of bars, skateboards and tattoo parlors as well as family resorts. Do your research before you book. And people drive like maniacs in this area. I witnessed a motorcycle/car hit and run and two fender benders on this small stretch from the hotel to the beach. Away from the ocean there are several nice restaurants and plenty of shopping. If you go south on Mission Bay Dr there are several family oriented parks and beaches as is the San Diego Visitor Center which offers discounted attraction tickets and hotel rooms. Customer Service: We had terrific customer service during the day and were completely ignored by anyone at the front desk during the evening. There is clearly an effort by management and staff to treat the customer better. The cleaning staff work room was at the basement level and there were several signs, written in spanish advising the employees on how to treat guests. Perhaps they should post a few at the front desk. In general, given the choices out there, I probably would not stay here again unless the price was $79 or so. Hope that helps anyone staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the reviews”
Reviews.Author: happy2be_running
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel through Hotwire for $85 a night on friday/saturday nights. Totally met my expectations of a Holiday Inn Express. Clean, decent continental breakfast, utilitarian but pleasant decor. The drawbacks were...tight but certainly available parking.....the cleaning products used did seem to have a distinctive odor but didn't notice it after a couple minutes. We wanted to be toward the mission bay/beach part of the city, and this barely qualified. If you have a choice, ask for a room on the west side of the building, away from the freeway. We ended up parking at the Old Town trolley station, and taking the trolley around a lot, thus in the future, I would maybe put a hotel within walking distance of a trolley station higher up on my list. But, truly for $85 on a friday & saturday night...this more than fit the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if possible”
Reviews.Author: Gigi1234
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in a lot of Holiday Inn Express locations and have always been impressed with their value. However, this hotel is the worst HIE I've experienced. The location next to a McDonalds, a self-storage facility and the freeway is really odd, and it seems like you are checking into a transient motel. It is nowhere near Mission Bay, despite its name. Parking lot was very difficult to navigate. Spaces were extremely narrow even for our compact car. The room was OK, but had that nursing-room-antiseptic smell and we didn't want to walk barefoot on the carpet. The phone and the Internet access didn't work, and the night desk clerk was very unprofessional when we asked him to fix the problem. The phone problem wasn't fixed until we repeatedly complained about it. The Internet access was never fixed. We went during high season in San Diego, and I suppose the high room rate reflected this. However, after this experience, I would rather pay a little more (or drive a little further inland or up the coast) and get a better room in a hotel/motel in a nicer location.

Reviews.Title: “Not any better than MOtel 6 for double the price”
Reviews.Author: tedisinla
Reviews.Content: The location is terrible. It is hard to get to. There are not enough parking. I had to park on the street. The celling is 7' and I cut my hand putting on a shirt in the bathroom because the celling was so low. The problems with this place is not seasonal or due to bad staff. It would be a okay motel but it advertises it self as a three star hotel but it is just a 1 1/2 star motel at best. No business center, no restraurant, no fitness room. It has a check in counter and a breakfast room that serves toast and some juice in the morning. The in room directory boasted of it's vending machine in the parking garage... now no 3 star anything should boast "VENDING MACHINES"!!

Reviews.Title: “Dont even think about staying here!!”
Reviews.Author: holidayinnsux
Reviews.Content: I am complaining b/c I recieved HORRIBLE service from a manager at this hotel. I was set to check in on the 4th of August and check out on the 7th of August. I left as early as I could on the 5th. At 11:15pm on the night of the 4th, I got a call from the front desk and it was the rudest man I have EVER spoken to. He said in a nasty totally annoyed tone 'your car alarm has been going off, come turn if off' I asked him 'so someone tried to break in?' He very rudely said 'look ive had 4 complaints-come down here and turn it off' I told him I wasn't going to apologize for my car alarm going off. I went downstairs and turned it off. There was no 'hey can you come turn your alarm off, we have security so we're watching the car-dont worry' None of that--it was just EXTREMELY rude like he was annoyed he had to call me to turn it off. about 10 min. later he called again and was just as rude if not even more so saying it's going off that I better go downstairs and turn it off. I have never had someone be so rude. I went back upstairs and booked another hotel for the remainder of my stay. When he called the 3rd time, I was on the phone with hotwire telling them what was happening and how I was being treated and telling them they need to take this hotel off of their website. My room mate answered the phone and said he, again, was extremely rude. The hotwire rep. that I was speaking to called this guy to get 'his side of the story' he said. When he came back on the line to me he said 'Ok-I know exactly what you're talking about-the guy basically hung up on me' This guy told the Hotwire Rep. that I either disconnect my alarm completely or I would be kicked off the property. There is a complaint filed through hotwire against this hotel and with all luck it WILL be taken off of their website. The man that was unneccesarily and extremely rude to me was Adam (atleast that's what he said his name was) there is no reason to speak to a paying guest like he spoke to me. I dont care if this hotel would be 10 dollars a night to stay, I would NEVER EVER EVER stay here or wish my worst enemy to stay here! On top of the rudeness, the hotel is on a hill and EXTREMELY hard to get in and out of. I have a normal sized car and the parking was SO TIGHT--it took atleast 10 min. to park every time. the parking is horrible, it's difficult to get in and out of to even go anywhere and the customer service was absolutely HORRIBLE! Use this hotel if: If you like having someone attempt to break in to your car and YOU being scolded for it Being spoken to EXTREMELY RUDELY you like BEING FORCED to turn your car alarm off in a not so nice part of town If you like taking 10 min. to park just to fit in the parking spaces If you like having trouble getting to and from your hotel Even though it's pretty cheap---it is NOT NOT NOT worth it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Rock Hard Beds, Otherwise OK”
Reviews.Author: elhawk2000
Reviews.Content: In contrast to the previous 4 or 5 posts, our experience was more positive. The room was spacious, clean and fairly quiet, especially with the a/c unit on "vent" all night. There was no fan in the bathroom, but that was only a minor inconvenience. The breakfast was great, with free juice, coffee, cinammon rolls, muffins, etc. The major drawback was the bed. Concrete might have been more comfortable. We ended up folding the bedspread and blanket in half, creating a cushion, and then putting the bottom sheet over the cushion. Room was warm enough that the top sheet alone was adequate to keep us warm. This hotel is a good choice for budget travelers. Great location and price. We got a deal from Hotwire at $58 per night, for 5 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Stinky, Gross Hot Tub”
Reviews.Author: Krissybelle
Reviews.Content: This hotel is NOT new. Do not be lured in by their website which claims this hotel is ALL NEW Holiday Inn Express. It might be new to their chain but the building is not new. The rooms are small and stale. They just downright stink. Bathrooms are riduculously small, and not vented. The hot tub was just filthy. I can't even go into details, it was just gross. Just take my word for it. Breakfast is "OK". I didn't find the parking to be difficult as others have stated and we had a midsize car. We also found the hotel to be quiet-I think it depends on the room you get. Staff was nice, but I just cannot recommend this place due to the smell and hot tub. It's inexpensive, but don't expect it to be like other Holiday Inn Express hotels which are usually not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it....just don't do it!”
Reviews.Author: coffee_boy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Holiday Inn Express in different places and have been reasonably satisfied....until now!!! Well, The Mission Bay location is terrible...located right behind a tire store on a hill. The property is crammed, it does not have a proper hotel entrance. Parking is tighter than the "posterior" of a rat! When you think you are in Mission Bay....that is a BIG stretch with this location. It is central, and close to the I-5 Highway, but not right in the main Mission Bay area. The room smelled bad, carpets were badly soiled, we were not comfortable to walk in bare feet. The bathroom had no exhaust....so when you shower...it totally fogs up. In short, don't stay at this place!! Even if you are trying to save a few BUCKS...Don't do it!! The whole place has bad VIBES!! As I was checking out...there was a crazy lady in the lobby trying to get a room with no credit card.....saying "god had sent her to this hotel". He must have been punishing her for something really bad. Stay away!!

Reviews.Title: “The Good, The Bad, The Average”
Reviews.Author: stonehair
Reviews.Content: Pluses: Good free breakfast spread, free but tight parking, plenty of towels, friendly housekeeping staff. Minuses: No hot water on first night, small bathroom, no exhaust fan in bath, noisy room heater, wall paper pealing below window, lack of pool/jacuzzi deck cleanliness, early morning fire alarm and building evacuation, bed railing protruding from bed (hazard), window lock completely detached, and lack of management support on weekends. I made reservations for a four-night (Tue â€“ Fri) stay. But, during the first evening, I discovered that I had no hot water. I contacted the front desk, and they agreed to waive the charges for my first nightâ€™s stay. In spite of our prior agreement, the lady on the front desk during my check-out said that she knew nothing of such a arrangement, and that I would have to contact her manager the following Monday because he only worked Monday thru Friday. Unfortunately, I had to depart the hotel with this matter still unresolved.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: FrankAProvidence_RI
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal through Hot Wire. Included are parking, continental breakfast, wireless internet, pool, hot tub, and small exercise room. Friendly and helpful staff. Convenient location right off Rt 5 gets you anywhere in San Diego you want to be. Clean and spacious bedroom, clean bathroom; microwave and refigerator in room. We stayed 7 nights. Quiet and comfortable. Used as a base for our visits to all attractions and day trips to LA, Rodeo Drive, etc. Hard to beat this great value. Not a destination hotel, and not a walking area, but rather a good money saver if you rather spend your money on attractions, shopping, restaurants, and Sunday brunch at the "Del".

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Comfy”
Reviews.Author: DHammondrn
Reviews.Content: Despite the reviews we stayed here for 4 nights. It is easy to get to, and clean. It was an added bonus to have a frig and a microwave in the HUGE room!! Nice staff!!

Reviews.Title: “Just average, but will not stay again”
Reviews.Author: weluvsandiego
Reviews.Content: I made the reservation through the hotel using my AAA card. I was quoted for 2 nights at $134 a night. I didn think this was too bad since it was a summer month. When we went to check out they charged $21 more for the second night. This place was not worth it. Room was average. Linens could have been better shape. The velour blanket had red stains (looked like dried food) on it that were clearly visible. which to me should have taken off and cleaned as soon as the person made the bed. we had to leave a note for the housekeeping to change the blanket. we also requested extra towels and not only did we not get extra, but for 2 people only had one bath towel. had to call the front desk, took almost an hour for them to bring more. no ice or vending machines on the floors. you had to go down to the garage to find the mahcines. i would not stay here again. for the money i would have stayed down the road in a cleaner place.

HotelInfo.Name: La Quinta Inn & Suites San Diego Mission Bay
HotelInfo.Address: 4610 De Soto Street, San Diego, CA 92109
